relationships.notes: Forced to carry Jesus’s cross behind him on the way to Golgotha, physically sharing in the path to crucifixion.
Is pressed into service by soldiers implementing Pilate’s sentence, illustrating how Roman authority could conscript passersby during crucifixions.

traits.compelled_to_carry_cross: Seized or compelled by the soldiers to carry Jesus’s cross on the way to Golgotha.
traits.identification_by_family: In Mark, identified as the father of Alexander and Rufus, suggesting that his family was known in early Christian circles.
traits.origin: Described as coming in from the country and being from Cyrene in North Africa, highlighting the diverse geography around the passion narrative.
traits.narrative_role: Serves as an unexpected participant in the passion, bearing the cross after Jesus and symbolically sharing in his suffering.
